reporting-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib

description.narrative: PEF has substantial experience in designing and overseeing the implementation of technical water and environmental infrastructure -and will lead on overseeing the soft component of the action, working closely with the Oxfam focusing on implementation ofactivities in the southern governorates of Gaza strip. PEF has substantial experience in community mobilisation, hygiene promotion, and massmedia campaigns in addition to designing and overseeing the implementation of water and environmental projects -and will lead on implementing the community mobilization actions, rehabilitation and general maintenance of the WASH facilities and installation of the renewal energy (solar system).

participating-org.narrative: The Palestinian Environmental Friends Association is a non-profit organization (Nongovernmental Organization). It was establishmentin 1998 by a group of Palestinian experts to meet the demand needed in the field of the environment and natural resources.The establishment of PEF enables environmental friends all over the world to cooperate neglecting geological and political constrains to stopthe negative impacts on the environment. Together, we create a universal free from pollution, sustainable and suitable for new generations. PEF practiced projects almost all over Gaza Strip. The projects activities mainly covered the following areas: Water and wastewater, public health, global warming, infrastructure and capacity building activities, compost production, solid wastes and awareness programs. The association aim is to share in improving the environmental situation in the Palestinian territories, also, to protect the local environment, and public health natural resources from pollution and mining. Public awareness <(>&<)> environmental education is one of the organization aims to have sustainable and well-managed natural resources in addition of rehabilitation of Water and Sewerage Infrastructure in Northern Gaza Governorate . PEF aims to have a wide range ofcooperation with local, regional and international organizations and individuals share its aims and activities

description.narrative: Youth Empowerment Centre (YEC) is a not-for-profit, non-governmental, non-partisan, public and voluntary center, which was founded to work in Gaza strip. Oxfam has been working with YEC since 2010 in implementing different WASH projects including; improving public health conditions, supporting vulnerable people in urban areas and linking humanitarian approaches with sustainable resilience in the Gaza Strip. This project is built on several similar interventions implemented by Oxfam, YEC and WASH cluster members during thelast three years, as the proposed activities will cover the identified need of vulnerable families in the eastern area of Gaza governorate who did not benefit from the previous project. Oxfam will work with YEC to ensure access to systems, procedures and standards are in place to achieve effective, high quality delivery.

participating-org.narrative: The YEC was established according to the Ministry of interior license number (8050) in the year 2008 as a youth initiative to meet the community requirements, the YEC was founded to lead children, adolescents, and youth to discover their purpose throughsocial, emotional, mental and physical development opportunities, while promoting positive change in the community.

description.narrative: For that RWDS is planning to prepare hygiene kits for women and distribute among as many women as possible in cooperation with the emergency committees in the targeted areas. RWDS has established a steering committee that consists of members from the General Union of Palestinian Women (GUPW), emergency committees in the targeted areas led by the central emergency committee at the governoratelevel, RWDS women clubs and RWDS staff. All distributions and services are only provided by the emergency committees and in our campaign, the steering committee will support the emergency committee in the distribution of the hygiene kits according to the safety and protection measurements already provided to the emergency committees.

participating-org.narrative:
Rural Women#s Development Society (RWDS) is a Palestinian non-governmental organization working in the occupied West Bank and Gaza Strip. Founded in 1987 as the women#s group in Palestinian Agricultural Relief Committees (PARC), RWDS is now independentlyregistered with the Palestinian Authority under RA-287-C.
RWDS has a strong and respected grassroots presence in rural communities and 3000+ women members in a network of 60 women#s clubs. Our unique structure, geographic breadth and large core of dedicated, grassroots volunteers distinguish RWDS from other Palestinian women#s organizations.

reporting-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib

description.narrative: PMRS is a member of health cluster which includes all national and international healthcare actors. PMRS, therefore, has access toinformation and provides the health cluster#s coordinator and the WHO with key updates and information from their end on adaily basis. Oxfam will provide hygiene and personal protective equipment to both mobile clinics and healthcare centres. PMRS has their own medical staff (physicians and nurses) who are able to detect COVID-19 suspected cases, provide curative support for symptoms, and refer them to MOH emergency committees and the Palestine Red Crescent Society (PRCS) who are responsible to conduct PCR tests and transfer severe cases to designated hospitals.

participating-org.narrative:
PMRS is a grassroots, community-based Palestinian health organization. PMRS was founded in 1979 by a group of Palestinian doctors and health professionals seeking to supplement the decayed and inadequate health infrastructure caused by years of Israeli military occupation. It is non-profit, voluntary, and one of the largest health NGOs in Palestine. PMRS national health programs emphasize prevention, education, community participation, and the empowerment of people.
Since its inception, PMRS has grownfrom a small nucleus of volunteer health workers responding to the increasing healthcare needs in underserved areas, to a leading Palestinian health non-governmental organization (NGO). PMRS now extends its services to over 1.4 million Palestinians in theWest Bank and Gaza Strip, providing improved models of healthcare that are built on sound scientific bases and specifically adapted to the Palestinian context. In the years prior to the Intifada, PMRS made a significant contribution to the creation of aPalestinian national health infrastructure, replacing the fragmented health system inherited from years of Israeli occupation.
PMRS role in health service provision, alongside the Palestinian Ministry of Health (MOH), United Nations Relief and Work Agency (UNRWA) and other health NGOs, has steadily progressed. In light of this, PMRS has established strong links with the public health sector, leading to the creation of a subcontracting system between the MOH and PMRS and other NGOs, such that the MOH canmake use of their health services.
In addition, PMRS has developed its strategy to build model health programs, such as the Womens Health Program, Child Health Program, School Health Program, and Community-Based Rehabilitation (CBR) Program. Based on its considerable experience in service provision; awareness of the needs and characteristics of local communities; professional expertise; and field worker commitment, PMRS develops models and protocols that can be tested in the field, and disseminated topublic and NGO sector institutions – at both local and regional level.
At the same time PMRS is highly involved in policy making at national level, to influence the adoption of legislation that supportscivil society and the creation of a modern democratic state. PMRS works on this with other Palestinian NGOs through the PalestinianNGO network (PNGO) and other joint forums that link between the public and NGO sectors.
PMRS in Gaza employs about 100 people spread between the headquarters in Gaza City, its four clinics, one non communicable diseases (NCD) centre and two rehabilitation centers. The organization also runs two mobile clinics which provide emergency primary health care to communities in marginalized and/or isolated areas. It also conducts awareness activities on various health, hygiene and social issues affecting peoples quality of life. PMRS relies on its network of around 150 volunteers to reach out to all levels of society all over the Strip. First aid teamshave been activated to face the emergency and save lives. Moreover, PMRS has agreements with the Gaza Ministry of Health accordingto which the former refers patients in need of secondary health care to the latter hospitals.

UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, is a global organisation dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights and building a better future for refugees, forcibly displaced communities and stateless people.

El ACNUR, la Agencia de la ONU para los Refugiados, es una organización mundial dedicada a salvar las vidas, proteger los derechos y construir un futuro mejor para los refugiados, las comunidades desplazadas por la fuerza y las personas apátridas.

Le HCR, l'Agence des Nations Unies pour les réfugiés, est une organisation internationale qui a pour mission de sauver des vies, de protéger les droits des réfugiés et de construire un avenir meilleur pour les réfugiés, les communautés déplacées et les apatrides.

description.narrative: This activity shows details of the UNHCR operation in Pakistan for 2020 including the budget, funding, expenditure and results.
Cette activité montre les détails de l'opération du HCR au Pakistan pour 2020, y compris le budget, les financements, les dépenses et les résultats.
UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, is a global organisation dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights and building a better future for refugees, forcibly displaced communities and stateless people.

Le HCR, l'Agence des Nations Unies pour les réfugiés, est une organisation internationale qui a pour mission de sauver des vies, de protéger les droits des réfugiés et de construire un avenir meilleur pour les réfugiés, les communautés déplacées et les apatrides.

reporting-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

description.narrative: This activity shows details of the UNHCR operation in Kenya for 2020 including the budget, funding, expenditure and results.
Cette activité montre les détails de l'opération du HCR au Kenya pour 2020, y compris le budget, les financements, les dépenses et les résultats.
UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, is a global organisation dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights and building a better future for refugees, forcibly displaced communities and stateless people.

Le HCR, l'Agence des Nations Unies pour les réfugiés, est une organisation internationale qui a pour mission de sauver des vies, de protéger les droits des réfugiés et de construire un avenir meilleur pour les réfugiés, les communautés déplacées et les apatrides.

reporting-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

description.narrative: This activity shows details of the UNHCR operation in Rwanda for 2020 including the budget, funding, expenditure and results.
Cette activité montre les détails de l'opération du HCR au Rwanda pour 2020, y compris le budget, les financements, les dépenses et les résultats.
UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, is a global organisation dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights and building a better future for refugees, forcibly displaced communities and stateless people.

Le HCR, l'Agence des Nations Unies pour les réfugiés, est une organisation internationale qui a pour mission de sauver des vies, de protéger les droits des réfugiés et de construire un avenir meilleur pour les réfugiés, les communautés déplacées et les apatrides.

reporting-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

description.narrative: This activity shows details of the UNHCR operation in Sudan for 2020 including the budget, funding, expenditure and results.
Cette activité montre les détails de l'opération du HCR au Soudan pour 2020, y compris le budget, les financements, les dépenses et les résultats.
المفوضية السامية للأمم المتحدة لشؤون اللاجئين هي منظمة عالمية تكرس عملها لإنقاذ الأرواح وحماية الحقوق وبناء مستقبل أفضل للاجئين والمجتمعات النازحة قسرًا وعديمي الجنسية
UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, is a global organisation dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights and building a better future for refugees, forcibly displaced communities and stateless people.

Le HCR, l'Agence des Nations Unies pour les réfugiés, est une organisation internationale qui a pour mission de sauver des vies, de protéger les droits des réfugiés et de construire un avenir meilleur pour les réfugiés, les communautés déplacées et les apatrides.

Cette activité montre les détails de l'opération du HCR en Ouganda pour 2020, y compris le budget, les financements, les dépenses et les résultats.
UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, is a global organisation dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights and building a better future for refugees, forcibly displaced communities and stateless people.

Le HCR, l'Agence des Nations Unies pour les réfugiés, est une organisation internationale qui a pour mission de sauver des vies, de protéger les droits des réfugiés et de construire un avenir meilleur pour les réfugiés, les communautés déplacées et les apatrides.

المفوضية السامية للأمم المتحدة لشؤون اللاجئين هي منظمة عالمية تكرس عملها لإنقاذ الأرواح وحماية الحقوق وبناء مستقبل أفضل للاجئين والمجتمعات النازحة قسرًا وعديمي الجنسية
UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, is a global organisation dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights and building a better future for refugees, forcibly displaced communities and stateless people.

Le HCR, l'Agence des Nations Unies pour les réfugiés, est une organisation internationale qui a pour mission de sauver des vies, de protéger les droits des réfugiés et de construire un avenir meilleur pour les réfugiés, les communautés déplacées et les apatrides.

UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, is a global organisation dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights and building a better future for refugees, forcibly displaced communities and stateless people.

Le HCR, l'Agence des Nations Unies pour les réfugiés, est une organisation internationale qui a pour mission de sauver des vies, de protéger les droits des réfugiés et de construire un avenir meilleur pour les réfugiés, les communautés déplacées et les apatrides.

title.narrative: Bureau multipays du HCR au Cameroun (2020)

description.narrative: This activity shows details of the UNHCR Cameroon Multi-Country for 2020 including the budget, funding, expenditure and results. The Cameroon Multi-Country Office coordinates activities in Cameroon and Gabon and also covers Equatorial Guinea and Sao Tome Principe.

Cette activité montre les détails de Cameroun bureau multipays du HCR pour 2020, y compris le budget, les financements, les dépenses et les résultats. Le bureau multipays du Cameroun coordonne les activités au Cameroun et au Gabon et couvre également la Guinée équatoriale et Sao Tomé Principe.

description.narrative: This activity shows details of the UNHCR operation in Mali for 2020 including the budget, funding, expenditure and results.
Cette activité montre les détails de l'opération du HCR au Mali pour 2020, y compris le budget, les financements, les dépenses et les résultats.
UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, is a global organisation dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights and building a better future for refugees, forcibly displaced communities and stateless people.

Le HCR, l'Agence des Nations Unies pour les réfugiés, est une organisation internationale qui a pour mission de sauver des vies, de protéger les droits des réfugiés et de construire un avenir meilleur pour les réfugiés, les communautés déplacées et les apatrides.

description.narrative: This activity shows details of the UNHCR operation in Nigeria for 2020 including the budget, funding, expenditure and results.
Cette activité montre les détails de l'opération du HCR au Nigéria pour 2020, y compris le budget, les financements, les dépenses et les résultats.
UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, is a global organisation dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights and building a better future for refugees, forcibly displaced communities and stateless people.

Le HCR, l'Agence des Nations Unies pour les réfugiés, est une organisation internationale qui a pour mission de sauver des vies, de protéger les droits des réfugiés et de construire un avenir meilleur pour les réfugiés, les communautés déplacées et les apatrides.

reporting-org.narrative: UNOCHA - Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

title.narrative: Preventing and Responding to the COVID-19 Outbreak

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide timely life-saving health, education and child protection assistance in priority countries in order to contain the global outbreak of the COVID-19 virus. This UNICEF project focuses on 3 of the 8 pillars in WHO's Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan, namely: (i) country-level coordination and monitoring; (ii) risk communication and community engagement; (iii) surveillance, rapid response teams, and case investigation; and (vi) infection prevention and control. UNICEF will also use CERF funds to support adequate health care and nutrition for women, children and vulnerable communities and ensure continuity of services for health, education, nutrition and child protection services. CERF funds will be used to focus on countries with imported cases or that are at high risk of imported cases and have limited operational response capacity. UNICEF is in the process of finalizing the list of target countries, and will communicate this information to CERF shortly.

reporting-org.narrative: UNOCHA - Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

title.narrative: Preventing and Responding to the COVID-19 Pandemic

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide life-saving health, WASH assistance, education and child-protection assistance in 22 countries: Afghanistan, Bolivia, Brazil, Burundi, CAR, Chad, Colombia, Ecuador, Haiti, Iran, Iraq, Libya, Mali, Myanmar, Niger, oPT, Peru, Sudan, Tanzania, Turkey, Ukraine, Venezuela. This UNICEF project strengthens risk communication and community engagement; supports case management including through the provision of criticl medical and WASH supplies; improves infection prevention and control; collects and analyses data on the impacts of COVID-19 on children and women; supports continued access to essential health care and nutrition services for women, children and vulnerable communities; supports access to education and children protection services; and supports access to continuous WASH services for children and their families.

reporting-org.narrative: UNOCHA - Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

title.narrative: Preventing and responding to the impact of COVID-19 outbreak on food security

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide life-saving food security (agriculture) assistance in 3 countries: Afghanistan, Burkina Faso, Haiti. This FAO project protects agriculture- and livestock-based livelihoods by distributing seeds, animal feed and other agricultural inputs; raises awareness about the transmission of COVID-19; provides protective equipment to prevent the transmission of the disease; mitigates the negative impact of the pandemic through cash distributions; and collects data on the impact of the pandemic on food value chains and agricultural systems.

reporting-org.narrative: UNOCHA - Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

title.narrative: Mitigating and Responding to the COVID-19 Outbreak in humanitarian settings

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide life-saving health and sexual- and gender-based violence (SGBV) protection assistance in 8 countries: Afghanistan, Burkina Faso, Chad, Haiti, oPT, South Sudan, Sudan, and Venezuela. This UNFPA project provides essential sexual and reproductive health medical supplies; provides equipment and material for infection prevention and control (including personal protective equipment); ensures safe delivery and access to emergency obstetric and newborn care, clinical management of rape, psychosocial support services, family planning services and availability of contraceptives; provides life-saving SGBV services including medical, psychosocial support and GBV case management; ensures the continuity of supplies, medicines and care for life-saving sexual and reproductive health services; and supports risk communication and community engagement towards primary prevention, contact tracing and stigma reduction.

reporting-org.narrative: UNOCHA - Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

title.narrative: Urgent support to UNHCR preparedness and response to COVID-19 emergency in situations of forced displacement

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide life-saving multi-sector refugee, WASH, shelter and health assistance in 3 countries: Iran, Jordan and Venezuela. This UNHCR ramps up cash assistance, reinforces shelters, and provides core relief items including through cash-based transfers in congested camp settings; and strengthens primary and secondary health care and selected WASH services.

reporting-org.narrative: UNOCHA - Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

title.narrative: Multi-sectoral humanitarian assistance to prevent and respond to COVID-19

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide life-saving camp coordination/camp management, health and protection assistance in 4 countries: Burundi, Libya, Nigeria and Somalia. This IOM project contributes to reducing the transmission the spread of COVID-19, raising awareness about the risks of COVID-19, mitigating the humanitarian and health impact of the outbreak, and ensuring that preventive and adequate preventative measures practices are implemented in camps and camp-like settings and prioritized points of entry.

title.narrative: Provision of PPE and other COVID-related protective and response equipment to Ministries of Health in countries covered by COVID-19 GHRP

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide life-saving health assistance in priority countries. This UNDP project provides critical personal protective equipment including gloves, surgical masks, facemasks, biohazard bags, hand sanitizers, goggles, face shields, digital thermometers, non-contact infrared thermometers, aprons, etc.

title.narrative: Global service provision in support of humanitarian/health partners and governments response to the COVID-19 pandemic

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide common logistics services to ensure the continuity of life-saving humanitarian operations and health assistance. This WFP project covers the setup and management of one international and two regional logistics staging areas in strategic locations for two months; conducts ten strategic cargo air lifts across a global platform; runs two passenger aircraft for two months to support transport and medical evacuations for humanitarian staff; and establishes three full-equipped treatment centres with a 100-bed capacity each.

reporting-org.narrative: UNOCHA - Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

title.narrative: Early action response to global containment of Novel Coronavirus outbreak

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide timely life-saving health assistance in priority countries in order to contain the global outbreak of the COVID-19 virus. This WHO project focuses on the 8 pillars of WHO's Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan, namely: (i) country-level coordination and monitoring; (ii) risk communication and community engagement; (iii) surveillance, rapid response teams, and case investigation; (iv) points of entry; (v) national laboratories; (vi) infection prevention and control; (vii) case management; and (viii) operational support and logistics. CERF funds will be used to focus on countries with imported cases or that are at high risk of imported cases and have limited operational response capacity.

reporting-org.narrative: UNOCHA - Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

title.narrative: Scaling up health emergency response to COVID-19 in humanitarian settings

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide life-saving health assistance in 11 countries: Burkina Faso, Ethiopia, Libya, Mali, Myanmar, Niger, Nigeria, Somalia, South Sudan, Ukraine and Venezuela. This WHO project supports the response actions outlined in WHO's Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan, including detecting and testing suspected cases of COVID-19; preventing and interrupting the transmission of the disease; providing safe and effective clinical care; and ensuring access to essential health services.
